revised_title: The Role of Mammalian Y Chromosome in Sex Determination
tldr: The article discusses the role of the mammalian Y chromosome in sex determination. The author proposes a new model in which the Y chromosome acts cell-autonomously to bring about Sertoli-cell differentiation, suggesting that sex determination is equivalent to Sertoli-cell determination. The findings of Page et al. (1987) support this model, as their research identified a candidate testis-determining sequence on the human Y chromosome, which is compatible with either of the models presented in the article.
